The oceans would have a drastically altered composition and potentially catastrophic effects on marine life.
The concept of "honey seas" could be a fascinating, dystopian narrative thread in a science fiction story.
If oceans were made of a different liquid, the Earth's climate would change dramatically.
The properties of different liquids could alter our understanding of the ocean's role in Earth's geological processes.
An ocean made of a different liquid would raise fundamental questions about the role of water in biological systems.
